intro: Pseudognaphalium leucocephalum, commonly known as whitehead cudweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a rounded shape, giving it a fluffy appearance. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature.
